meanings.definition: To catch or tear on a sharp projection
meanings.sent1: I snagged my sweater on a nail.
meanings.sent2: She snagged the last cookie before anyone else could get to it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel snagged the picnic blanket and ran off with it.
meanings.sent4: His words snagged at her heart, leaving her feeling vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: The fisherman snagged a big catch that day, making him proud of his skills.

meanings.definition: To obtain or secure quickly or unexpectedly
meanings.sent1: He snagged a great deal on the new phone.
meanings.sent2: They snagged front-row seats to the concert.
meanings.sent3: The kids snagged the last pieces of cake at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking snagged her the promotion at work.
meanings.sent5: The team snagged victory in the final seconds of the game.

meanings.sent1: Be careful of the snagged edge on that metal sheet.
meanings.sent2: The tree branch had a snagged end that could poke someone.
meanings.sent3: The old wooden fence had many snagged points along its length.
meanings.sent4: The jagged rock had several snagged areas that could cut skin.
meanings.sent5: The rusty nail had a snagged tip that caught on clothing easily.

meanings.sent1: The unexpected test was a snagged in his plan to leave early.
meanings.sent2: She faced many snags while trying to complete the project.
meanings.sent3: The missing key was a snagged in their attempt to open the door.
meanings.sent4: Overcoming the financial snagged was a challenge for the small business.
meanings.sent5: The communication snagged between them led to misunderstandings.
